Main pronunciation 主要发音: liǔ

Original meaning 本义: Meaning willow tree.

English senses 英语理解: willow tree; pleasure

Usage example 用法举例: 楊柳 yáng liǔ (poplar and willow)

Shuowen 说文解字: 小楊也從木丣聲丣古文酉

桺字的基本解释

桺
liǔ
古同“柳”。

桺字的汉语字典释义

[①]［liǔ］
［《廣韻》力久切，上有，來。］
亦作“栁1”。亦作“桞1”。亦作“桺1”。亦作“橮1”。
(1)落叶乔木或灌木，枝条柔韧，叶子狭长，种子有毛。种类很多，有垂柳、旱柳等。
(2)指柳木简。
(3)指垂柳枝。多用以形容女子腰肢。
(4)代指春。参见“柳風”、“柳信”。
(5)比喻美女。多用以指歌姬、娼妓。
(6)聚集。
(7)古代棺饰和柩车饰的总称。
(8)丧车。亦为车的通称。
(9)见“柳柳驚”。
(10)量词。绺，束。多用于须、发、线等。
(11)星宿名。二十八宿之一。南方朱鸟七宿的第三宿。
(12)古代五声中“羽”的别名。
(13)古地名。春秋时周室之邑，后为晋所侵。故址在今山西省乡宁县一带。
(14)古地名。春秋鲁地。在今河北省盐山县东。
(15)姓。
[②]［liú］
［《字彙補》力求切］
亦作“栁2”。通“瘤1”。

桺字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　桺； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页527第15
【說文】柳本字。从木丣聲。丣，古文酉。詳柳字註。

字源演变：

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [liǔ]
["Guangyun" cuts hard for a long time, come on, come on. ]
Also known as "栁1". Also known as "桞1". Also known as "桺1". Also known as "橮1".
(1) Deciduous trees or shrubs, with flexible branches, long and narrow leaves, and hairy seeds. There are many types, including weeping willow and dry willow.
(2) Refers to willow bamboo slips.
(3) Refers to weeping willow branches. Mostly used to describe the waist of a woman.
(4) Refers to spring. See "Liu Feng", "Liu Xin".
(5) Metaphor for beautiful women. Mostly used to refer to singers and prostitutes.
(6) Gathering.
(7) The general term for ancient coffin ornaments and hearse ornaments.
(8) Murder. It is also a generic term for cars.
(9) See "Jing Liu Liu".
(10) Quantifiers. Twisted, bundled. It is mostly used for beard, hair, thread, etc.
(11) The name of the constellation. One of twenty-eight nights. The third place of the seven places of southern vermilion bird.
(12) The alias of "Yu" in the ancient Five Tones.
(13) Ancient place names. In the Spring and Autumn Period, the town of Zhou Dynasty was invaded by Jin. The former site was in the area of Xiangning County, Shanxi Province today.
(14) Ancient place names. Spring and Autumn Lu land. In today's east of Yanshan County, Hebei Province.
(15) Last name.
[②]［liú］
["Zihuibu" strives to be cut]
Also known as "栁2". Link "Tumor 1".
No
